text: Hi is there a way to add autoplay=1 and loop=1 to youtubes <iframe ?

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="<https://www.youtube.com/embed/iApVVKsF94E>" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
I want to append ?controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&loop=1  at the end of the src
I am new to HubL. I want to learn it to use it in server side. Help me with good resources, sample codes or links. Thanks!!

I would start with HubSpot documentation on HubL:
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/intro-to-hubl>
Hey <@U2H3TT8F2> thanks, it was helpful. How do I insert python in HubL?  I'm trying to connect to an external database.
you can’t as far as I’m aware
and if you want to connect an external database you’re going to need to use API’s to do it
Correct, you can't use python in there

Hello
<@UH8USUDNF> here!
I want to help everyone's HubSpot project!

how can I add a manageable cta module with hubl in a blog post, I'm trying with this
{% cta "cta" label = 'Select a CTA', export_to_template_context = True%}

but it does not work for me, take this as a reference

{% image "background_image" label = 'Select a background image',
src = 'http: //cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/428357/file-2117441560-jpg/img/dev-bg-compressed.jpg',
export_to_template_context = True%}

What am I doing wrong or in what way can I do it?
this might be a dumb question, how do you find the file ID?
I think you have to hit the files API. I put up an issue to expose this through the UI easier
